701644f-a.text:
Post Road, west side, between West 253rd and 254th Streets, showing the site where the Henry Hudson Parkway was cut through running perpendicular to the Post Road.

April 23, 1935
P.L. Sperr

700379f-a.text:
West 253rd Street (Riverdale Lane), north side, west of Post Road. The view is in a northeasterly direction from the above point across the line of the future Henry Hudson Parkway. The brick house, visible in the center, is on the west side of Post Road between West 253rd and West 254th Streets, directly in the course of the proposed parkway. In the backround appears Van Cortlandt Park.
April 23, 1935.
P. L. Sperr.

701641f-a.text:
(1) Post Road (right), at the N.W. corner of West 253rd Street (formerly Riverdale Lane), showing an old 2 1/2 story frame house, the home of J.B. James

April 23, 1935
P.L. Sperr

(2) The same, showing the west 253rd Street side.
April 23, 1935

701641f-b.text:
(1) Post Road (right), at the N.W. corner of West 253rd Street (formerly Riverdale Lane), showing an old 2 1/2 story frame house, the home of J.B. James

April 23, 1935
P.L. Sperr

(2) The same, showing the west 253rd Street side.
April 23, 1935

701642f-a.text:
Post Road, east side, at West 253rd Street (in the middle of the street), showing an old 2-story frame house in a state of disuse.

April 23, 1935

P.L. Sperr

701643f-a.text:
Post Road, north from and including West 253rd Street.
April 23, 1935
P.L. Sperr
